data.title: Amazon asks employees to avoid ‘non-essential’ travel to mitigate coronavirus risk
data.text: Amazon is asking its employees to defer all “non-essential” travel in response to the novel coronavirus (COVID-19) that is spreading across the world.

data.title: 4 Top Stock Trades for Monday: QQQ, AMZN, TTD, AYX
data.text: The QQQ ETF, Trade Desk, Alteryx and Amazon are our top stock trades for Monday. Overall, it's been a tough week for investors.

data.title: Amazon tells employees to pause non-essential travel in U.S. due to coronavirus
data.text: Amazon has started restricting all non-essential employee travel in the U.S. as the coronavirus continues to spread.

data.title: Amazon is the latest to ditch GDC this year
data.text: GDC’s top sponsors continue to pull out of attending the San Francisco gaming conference. Today, Amazon announced it would no longer be sending employees to the event.

data.title: Amazon now operates seven different kinds of physical stores. Here's why
data.text: When you have $11.6 billion in annual profits, you can afford to experiment.

data.text: A new petition asks the trade regulator to look more closely at the e-commerce giant.

data.title: Deep Dive: Why Netflix has escaped the carnage engulfing other FAANG stocks
data.text: This has been a very rough week for U.S. investors, who had gotten used to a steady bull market.

data.title: Amazon pulls the plug on coronavirus price gougers
data.text: Amazon said it has pulled down “tens of thousands” listings for face masks whose sellers have been price gouging amid the coronavirus panic. Some merchants have been looking to take advantage of the crisis amid growing anxiety about the global epidemic, which has infected more than 80,000 people around the world and killed nearly 3,000,.

data.title: The Real Opportunity Behind Amazon’s ‘No Wait’ Grocery
data.text: Amazon stock will capitalize on advancing tech as it opens its first large-scale Go Grocery. Here's what you need to know.

data.title: How Amazon's Go Grocery Store 'Won Another Battle' Against Retail
data.text: Amazon.com, Inc. (NASDAQ: AMZN) has yet to win the war against the physical retail universe but it certainly scored a victory with the launch of its new grocery store concept, according to Loup Ventures' Andrew Murphy.

data.title: Amazon Removes 1M Products For Claiming To Cure Coronavirus, Inflating Prices
data.text: Amazon.com Inc. (NASDAQ: AMZN) has removed more than a million products from its e-commerce platform that attempted to profit from the novel coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak, CNBC reported Thursday.

data.title: AWS partners with Kenya’s Safaricom on cloud and consulting services
data.text: Amazon Web Services has entered a partnership with Safaricom — Kenya’s largest telco, ISP and mobile payment provider — in a collaboration that could spell competition between American cloud providers in Africa. In a statement to TechCrunch, the East African company framed the arrangement as a “strategic agreement” whereby Safaricom will sell AWS services (primarily cloud) […]
